subclusters.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
Mitochondrial ROS and Hormonal Regulation of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hypothalamic regulation of reproductive senescence via GnRH neurons and neuroendocrine feedback loops controlling ovarian function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis dysfunction and altered feedback causing reproductive aging independent of ovarian reserve.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes conserved neuroendocrine mechanisms in birds linking hypothalamic and gonadal regulation to reproductive senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights hormonal coordination linking reproductive senescence and systemic aging via neuroendocrine changes preceding or following oocyte loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hypothalamic inflammation as a causal driver of reproductive and systemic aging, especially in women during menopause.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Leptin-mediated neuroendocrine modulation of hypothalamic-pituitary axes affects reproductive suppression and antiaging effects under dietary restriction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Dillman hypothalamic receptor threshold theory links hypothalamic receptor dysfunction to metabolic decline and aging, implicating hypothalamic nuclei in systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hypothalamic Control of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Neuroendocrine hypothalamic degeneration model shows hypothalamic neuronal loss reduces GHRH and GH secretion, linking hypothalamic dysfunction to systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on progressive decline of key hormonal systems (sex steroids, GH/IGF-1, DHEA) causing frailty and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related endocrine changes across multiple axes causing metabolic, immune, and musculoskeletal decline, supporting endocrine dysregulation as aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Steinach’s autoplastic rejuvenation theory links gonadal hormone decline and manipulation to systemic aging and rejuvenation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Testosterone deficiency accelerates cardiomyocyte aging; physiological testosterone delays aging markers, highlighting hormone deficiency impact on aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Prenatal testosterone exposure causes oxidative damage, linking early hormonal environment to aging-related cellular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Neuroendocrine feedback disruption theory shows aging causes loss of coordinated hormone secretion and feedback, reflecting systemic endocrine decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Pleiotropic effects of HPT axis in longevity involve altered TSH secretion without thyroid hormone changes, indicating endocrine axis modulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endocrine Decline and Hormonal Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Retinoic acid modulation of glucocorticoid pathway links hormonal signaling decline to cognitive aging and hippocampal plasticity loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on individual differences in HPA axis aging, stress-induced corticosterone secretion, and behavioral predictors of accelerated neuroendocrine aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cortisol responsivity to mental stress with accelerated telomere attrition, implicating stress-related neuroendocrine activation in cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hormonal pleiotropy and trade-off theory describes how hormones mediate trade-offs between reproduction, survival, and stress, influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Juvenile hormone regulation of senescence links hormonal control of reproduction and survival trade-offs to aging dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Neuroendocrine regulation of Drosophila aging via insulin, juvenile hormone, and ecdysone signaling integrates environmental cues with aging rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hormonal regulation of aging theory highlights insulin/IGF and steroid hormones as lifespan regulators via gene expression and metabolic pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Pituitary hormone withdrawal extends lifespan by reducing GH/IGF-1 and thyroid hormones, linking neuroendocrine signaling to aging control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: HPA Axis and Stress-Related Neuroendocrine Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Endocrine regulation of aging in Drosophila emphasizes systemic hormonal signaling integration of environmental and internal cues affecting lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Hormonal Regulation of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hormonal control of cytochrome c oxidase activity regulates mitochondrial membrane potential and ROS formation, linking hormonal signaling to oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Hormonal Regulation of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: RXFP3/RLN3 signaling modulates DNA damage response, oxidative stress, and mitochondrial function, integrating neuroendocrine control with metabolic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Hormonal Regulation of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Synaptic transmission genes regulated by insulin/IGF-1 signaling affect aging and dauer formation, linking neuronal signaling to systemic aging pathways.
